title: panic when syncing large repo on samba share

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Hi,

I encountered a panic after having installed Syncthing 0.9.17 on a debian wheezy and configured it to sync with another node a repository of a few thousand small files. Dunno if it's relevant, but the repository is located on a mounted samba share.
Syncthing crashes during startup, and here is the generated panic log:

```
Panic at Sat, 20 Sep 2014 21:42:43 CEST
[MH63L] 21:42:17 INFO: syncthing v0.9.17 (go1.3.1 linux-amd64 default) jenkins@build.syncthing.net 2014-09-18 10:01:08 UTC
[MH63L] 21:42:17 INFO: My ID: MY-SYNCTHING-ID
[MH63L] 21:42:17 INFO: Starting web GUI on http://127.0.0.1:8080/
[MH63L] 21:42:23 INFO: Performing initial repository scan
[MH63L] 21:42:43 INFO: No UPnP gateway detected
[MH63L] 21:42:43 INFO: Starting local discovery announcements
[MH63L] 21:42:43 INFO: Starting global discovery announcements
[MH63L] 21:42:43 OK: Ready to synchronize default (read-write)
[MH63L] 21:42:43 OK: Ready to synchronize MY_REPO (read only; no external updates accepted)
[MH63L] 21:42:43 INFO: Versioner: error scanning versions dir lstat /mnt/MY_MOUNTPOINT/.stversions: no such file or directory
...
```
